definitions.definition: (used to emphasize something) completely; in every way

examples.text: The train went slower and slower until it stopped altogether.
I don't altogether agree with you.
I am **not altogether** happy *(= I am very unhappy)* about the decision.
It was an altogether different situation.
I’m not altogether convinced, I’m afraid.

definitions.definition: used to give a total number or amount
used to introduce a summary when you have mentioned a number of different things

examples.text: The food was good and we loved the music. Altogether it was a great evening.

wordOrigin: Old English, composite of all and together.
